Job Opportunities

Project Coordinator, Student Engagement

Job Summary

The Bloomberg Harvard City Leadership Initiative is an ambitious joint effort of Harvard Kennedy School and Harvard Business School, in close collaboration with and funded by Bloomberg Philanthropies, to advance leadership, management, and innovation in cities. As part of the newly announced Bloomberg Center for Cities at Harvard University, the Initiative equips mayors and senior city officials with the skills, tools, and techniques to tackle the leadership and management challenges they face in their cities.

The City Support and Student Engagement team within the Initiative leads relationship management with the Initiative’s growing network of cities and student opportunities across that network. The team’s primary focus is to ensure effective and transferable learning for each cohort of city leaders and experiential learning opportunities for students (through student fellowships).

Job-Specific Responsibilities

Reporting to the Program Manager for Student Engagement, and working closely with Initiative leadership and staff, students across Harvard, and cities, the Project Coordinator will serve an integral role in ensuring outstanding execution of administrative, programmatic, and operational services for student programming and events.‍

Key responsibilities include:

Coordinate Activities with City Officials, Students, and Key Stakeholders:
  • Manage logistics, communications, and follow-up with senior city officials, graduate students, and key stakeholders for activities such as progress check-ins, interviews, and scoping conversations for key student opportunities (student fellowships, field courses, capstone thesis projects, research, etc.). Lead preparation (including background research), maintain records and notes, and conduct critical follow-up
  • Coordinate hiring and onboarding processes for student fellows, research assistants, and summer associates. Edit project scopes/job descriptions, candidate requirements, and background information from cities
  • Track student progress, flag and help address challenges, and surface needs.
  • Create and manage work plans, with keen attention to deadlines, interdependencies, and risks. Develop standard operating procedures and process improvements
  • Initiate and maintain partnerships across Harvard graduate student programs.
  • Draft and assist in production of high-quality reports, presentations, memos, and materials
  • Coordinate outreach to student groups across Harvard to ensure wide reach of information about student opportunities
  • Support the development, launch, and execution of new postgraduate fellowships
‍Convenings and events:
  • Manage key student events; coordinate and produce key student events across Harvard graduate schools, such as an annual Meet and Greet and Summer Fellowship Overview
  • Onboarding for Research Assistants and Fellowship Kick-Off events; prepare convening materials and coordinate with speakers and guests
‍Program Impact:
  • Track and document progress; organize, manage, analyze, and track ongoing progress and impact of student work with cities via CRM and other means
  • Track equity metrics for student programming
‍Team Advancement:
  • Foster and contribute to a culture of excellence grounded in learning, problem solving, and teamwork
  • Collaborate with colleagues to identify recommendations for improvements

Basic Qualifications

• Bachelor's Degree and 4 years of progressively responsible experience inclusive of supporting students, cities, or some similar organization
• Advanced experience with Microsoft Suite, Salesforce, Zoom, and project management tools

Additional Qualifications and Skills

  • Track record of consistently exceeding expectations, delivering on time, and producing high-quality output
  • Strong organizational skills with an ability to build productive relationships, secure information, and accomplish work across all levels of a diverse organization
  • Excellent presentation and writing skills
  • Skill in managing multiple diverse activities simultaneously, delivering on commitments, and operating with speed, accuracy, and strong judgment
  • A passion for cities and public sector innovation
  • An appetite for trying and testing new ideas
  • Extraordinary diligence and thoroughness, with the ability to drive to big picture goals
  • A strong customer service orientation coupled with persistent follow-up
  • A strong work ethic and resolute integrity
  • Excellent interpersonal skills that resonate with diverse audiences
  • We are committed to building and fostering a diverse and inclusive team of staff, students, and faculty, and we seek candidates who share our commitment and values
  • Experience working with administrators, faculty, and students a plus

Additional Information

We regret that the Harvard Kennedy School does not provide Visa Sponsorship.
Harvard University requires pre-employment references and background checks.
Harvard University is committed to supporting a healthy, sustainable learning and working environment.

Please note: This is an in-person/on campus position based in Cambridge, MA, with possible flexible work options.

Harvard will require COVID vaccination for all Harvard community members who will have any on-campus presence. Individuals may claim exemption from the vaccine requirement for medical or religious reasons. More information regarding the University’s COVID vaccination requirement and exceptions may be found at the University’s “COVID-19 Vaccine Information” webpage: http://www.harvard.edu/coronavirus/covid-19-vaccine-information/.
